title: Fix Fibonacci Return Value
prompt: Fix fib(n) so that fib(0)=0, fib(1)=1. The starter code returns the wrong value for small n.

hint: Your base case treats 0 and 1 the same, returning 1, which shifts the whole sequence and leads to 13 for fib(6). Split the base cases so that n === 0 returns 0 and n === 1 returns 1. Keep the recursive step unchanged for n > 1. After adjusting, log fib(0..6) to verify the sequence 0,1,1,2,3,5,8.

title: Fibonacci with Memoization
prompt: Fix fib(n) to compute the n-th Fibonacci number (0-indexed; fib(0)=0, fib(1)=1) using top-down memoization. n can be up to 92 (fits in long). Avoid recomputation by caching results; do not recreate the cache per recursive call.
